title: React ToDo Local Storage
text: During the course of this series, we’ll use React to build out a todo app that saves and loads to local storage.

title: One Thing React App
text: In this series, we’ll build out a simple React project to introduce important React concepts like components, props, state, and more.

title: Parallax Landing Page
text: In this series, we’ll build out a parallax landing page using Tailwind, HTML, and JavaScript.

title: Tailwind Landing Page
text: I’ll show the basics of Tailwind 3, including how to customize and extend it. Then we’ll build out a fully-responsive light/dark mode landing page from scratch.

title: Responsive Navigation
text: In this video, I'll show you how to create a fully responsive navigation menu with HTML, CSS, and Vanilla JavaScript. We’ll add aria attributes to achieve a basic accessible navigation.

title: Figma-to-Astro
text: This project done for the Net Ninja channel is a full design-to-code landing page. We’ll use Figma for design and the Astro SSG for the code.

title: Calendar Event Page
text: Using the Google Calendar API, we’ll build out a custom event’s page with Tailwind CSS and vanilla JavaScript. We’ll also setup a Netlify serverless function to safely handle the API calls.

title: Analogue Clocks
text: We’ll build custom SVG world clocks in both functional and object oriented programming styles using the requestAnimationFrame API and the date-fns library.

title: Password Generator
text: In this video, we’ll use ParcelJS, Tailwind CSS, and an npm package called Check Password Strength to write a custom password generator app.

title: Notion CMS
text: In this series, we’ll create a light-weight CMS using a Notion database, the Notion SKD for JavaScript, a Netlify serverless function with the Netlify CLI, and a few other tools.

title: Accordion Component
text: In this video, we’ll create an accessible accordion component with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript that will include keyboard events, ARIA attributes, ARIA roles, and more.

title: Popup Gallery
text: In this series, we’ll create a popup modal with an infinite image slider with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Click on any image open its custom gallery.

title: Blog Post Filter
text: In this project, we use client-side JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to build out a fully-responsive blog post filter. As site visitors type, the JS filters 600 posts and dynamically displays the most recent posts matching the query.

title: Tab Component
text: In this project, we’ll build out a tab component, focusing especially on accessibility and object oriented programming.

title: Blog Post Layout
text: Laying out a page with grid and flex box can be confusing. In this two part series, I’ll show you how to layout a page using a combination of grid and flex box. We’ll create a fully-responsive design with modern CSS.

title: Light Dark
text: In this series, we’ll convert a site using hard-coded colors to use css variables, let the site automatically respond to the user’s system theme, and then manually choose betwen light and dark mode.

title: Review Slider
text: Learn how to load and parse data from a JSON file, update the UI with customer reviews, and create an infinite carousel without transitions.

title: Image Slider
text: Learn how to load and parse data from a JSON file, update the UI with images, clone the first and last elements, and create an infinite carousel slider with transitions.

title: Coffee Recipes
text: In this video, we’ll build a recipe app from scratch using Bootstrap and Vanilla JavaScript.

title: Audio Player
text: We’re building out a fully-responsive audio music player with plain 'ol HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. We’ll be pulling the info from a “server” and then using that data to populate the UI and play the audio.

title: Notes App
text: In this three-part project, we’ll build a note taking app from scratch. We’ll use only HTML, CSS (well, SCSS), and Javascript and store all notes in the user’s local storage.
